item.description:
Hi Everyone,



Weather: Saturday: Patchy fog before 8am. Otherwise, sunny, with a high near 80. Calm wind becoming south around 6 mph.

http://www.usairnet.c...

PLEASE PARK DOUBBLE WITH OURSELVES THAT WILL STAY FOR THE WHOLE DAY, ETC, THE LOT IS SMALL..ETC..

The Last time we were up here the water was interestingly perfect, and good for a swim later.

Bring a lunch for the shore or one of the islands..

Bring your chair and pot luck food for after, towel and dry clothes too..etc.....

This is a change from the ocean since all of you are now tired of ocean stuff..


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Trip starts (Left) upstream from the boat ramp till we can't go any more...
Water flow is kept going but there has been no rain for a while..etc

On the way up take some pics, you will SEE why..

There may be some people that look like Diliverance People on the river bank FISHEN, BARBIE-Q'ing AND BATHING..dont worry they dont know how to swim, and if they are in the water taking a bath, with all the teeth missing just splash em and they get a mouth full of water and choke so they will stay away from your snacks.....

Then on the downstream pass by the boat ramp and head down to the coves, islands, and Dam..etc..

I hear there will be an ALIEN in the water at sometime or somewhere along the way of the trip.

_____________________________________________________________


GETTING THERE:

From Hartford, CT:


Merge onto I-91 N toward Springfield- 25.9 mi

Just North of Springfield city
Take exit x? for I-291 E/US-20 EAST toward I-90/Mass.Pike E AST
0.2 mi

follow signs for I-291 East and merge onto I-291 EAST/US-20 East
Continue to follow I-291 EAST for 5.0 mi

Take the I-90 EAST/I-90 W exit toward Masspike/Boston/Albany
0.3 mi

Merge onto I-90 EAST toward Boston Direction and go apx 11.5 mi

Take exit 8 toward MA-32/US-20/Palmer/Ware
0.3 mi

Merge onto Palmer Ware
Partial toll road

Once under the Mass Pike bridge, take a left onto HIGH st for 0.4 miles

Keep Right onto CHURCH st then take RIVER st for 1.4 miles

Take a left onto STATE st go apx 0.7 miles

Bear Right onto JIM ASS st for 1.1 miles

Keep strait on and Continue onto Bondsville Rd for 1.5 mi

Turn left at Cold Spring Rd and go apx 0.1 miles or over bridge and turn left into the parking lot,
Park so we can all fit...
This is a small lot and its a popular spot so park where you can.

(The other alt route is I-84 to Stafford Springs and up 32..etc..)

OR Just follow your GPS: and maps..
525 Cold Spring Rd
Belchertown, MA 01007


xxxxxxxxxXxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Kayaks available:

Paddle & Leash, Life Jacket with whistle is included with any of my yaks.

Dougnation of $ 20.00, bucks for my kayaks reserved for this particular event.
Its way less than what sport shops charge and the yaks & Paddles are top quality delivered and picked up at the site etc..

Please make sure you are familiar with the yak you choose and can fit in them since i don't have any wide yaks anymore.


I will only bring the yaks that are confirmed by a yes and by persons i have some familiarity with..

Maybee's obviously can't reserve any yaks and if ya reserve one and don't show up ya won't ever get a second chance to again.

Sorry i don't like to leave un-attended yaks on the trailer. They get stolen too easily.


IF USING MY YAKS YOU CANT LOOK LIKE A BONEHEADED BEGINNER AND STEP INTO THEM VIA THE FLOOR OR DRIVE UP ON SHORE WITH THEM LIKE YOU ARE GOING TO A DRIVE IN MOVIE. Only Novices in cheap plastic boats do that...

READ THE INFO ON THE FOLLOWING LINK: I will also show you the correct way and you will look like a intelligent seasoned pro and impress the others who don't know how. Or you may laugh at the ones that fall in who don't know how.
http://www.ehow.com/h...
Hint: always get out parallel to shore.

Please review the links below for the equipment specifications to be at least familiar with which boat or equipment you would be best suited for.

Cheap LIfe Jackets with a whistle is all i have for you since a GOOD QUALITY LIFE JACKET should be chosen for your particular body shapes and paddling style, and tight fit adjusted...if you have your own please bring it..
------------------
All my yaks come with Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths and types of the same version are in the bucket.

http://www.wernerpadd...

(No ya cant use these paddles for paddle float entry practice. i have some cheap ones for that.)-
------------------

Also for comfort is my favourtie Yak Pad optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere..

http://www.yakpads.co...


----------------------

BOW DECK BAGS are now placed on kayaks to hold water , accessories and other items needed for quick and easy access:

http://www.kayakprosh...

------------------------------

Eddyline Wind Dancer, Red, Rudder Equipped.
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with Novice and up skills.

http://www.epinions.c...

highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable Sea kayak, 18'=
---------- ---RESERVED FOR MARK K ---

---------------------------------

NDK Greenlander Pro, Red, Skeg Equipped.
Medium sized paddler (120-150 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced skills.

http://www.atlanticka...

Fast Greenland style Sea kayak, moderated stability, 18'=
---..--- ---RESERVED FOR AL-R--.

----------------------------------

Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the mid sized cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"=
---------- ----RESERVED FOR ALEX---

------------------------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light (thin) Fiberglass (Modified floor area), Yellow, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"=
-------- ----RESERVED FOR JoAnne-- --

-----------------------------------

Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the heaviest model and larger cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.neckykayak...

stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (50 LB) ladies kayak, 15'3.5"= ---------- ----RESERVED FOR DEB----


----------------------------------

Guillemot Night Heron

Greenland Paddle available also if desired.

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with beginner/intermediate and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-...

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with Greenland style hull (45 lbs), 18' =
---------- ---RESERVED FOE TRICE- --



-----------------------------------------------------------------


Ok see ya all there.
al-r

item.name: *KAYAKING THE "COLD SPRING" RIVER* & Pot Luck Barbie-Q Riverside or Nearby.
